titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Keeler Brothers magazine prospectus 1979.011
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-18T14:59-0500

did.abstract: A one-page printed prospectus for publication of the periodical "Once-a-Week" to "aid in the promotion of the welfare and growth of the Village of Roslyn, Long Island, New York." The prospectus is dated 1876 and is attributed to a company called Keeler Brothers, presumably a publishing or printing company.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Keeler Brothers magazine prospectus, 1979.011, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1979.
